p: Dermal administration of nanostructured systems containing terpenes and EO is, in general, mainly used as a treatment for conditions localized on the skin surface, such as for wound healing, and to vehiculate anti-inflammatory, antimicrobial, and repellent agents. On the other hand, transdermal delivery is employed in cases where the bioactive compound needs to reach deeper layers of the skin or even the systemic circulation, such as for anesthetic, antihypertensive, and antidiabetic drugs ( Table 1 and Table 2).
